1.content:
Pick your gentle giant:

Mike: 13 years old. Short blond hair, 4'10. One of the shortest kids in his class. He is not picked on by kids, but isn't the most popular kid in school.

David: 17 years old. Shaggy brown hair, 5'10. He is the most popular guy in school. Has most of the girls (and even some of the guys) crushing on him. He's not a stuck-up guy though, he is nice to everybody.

Bill: 40 years old. Short black hair, 5'7. Bill is the single father of two boys, Henry and Matt. He works at an office job and is sometimes bored with his life, hoping for a BIG change in his life.

Steven: 22 years old. Short brown hair, 5'9. Steven is a college student. He is smart, but does attend some frat parties around campus. He isn't the most popular guy on campus, but he does have alot of friends.
1.title: First pick

11.content:
Mike was walking down the hallway in his school. He was in 7th grade, but he was one of the shortest kids in the class. It didn't matter though. No one picked on him, but they didn't pay alot of attention to him either.

"Mike!"

Mike turned to see his best friend Josh jogging up to him. Josh was 5'2 with shaggy blond hair. They had been friends for a couple years and treated each other like brothers.

"What's up Josh?" Mike asked.

"Hey, did you want to come by my house later today? I just got that new video game, "Zombies Attack 5" yesterday and you know we;ve been waiting forever for-"

"Don't need to think about it Josh. I'll be by right after school". Josh smiled and quickly headed toward his class before he was late. Even though they were friends, the only times they saw each other during school was in between classes and lunch.

------------------------------------------------------------------

Mike knew Josh had gotten a head start once school got out. As Mike walked along the sidewalk, he noticed something shining in front of him. He stopped and picked it up. It was a stone, but it was glowing green.

"Almost alien-like or something" he muttered to himself. He still thought it was cool, so he put it in his pocket and walked towards Josh's house.

111.content:
As Mike walked along, he became aware that his shoes seemed more uncomfortable. Like they were getting tighter or something... It wasn't painful yet, so he kept going. Maybe his feet were swelling? His teacher sometimes complained about that. It had never happened to him before, but hey, first time for everything.
Actually, all his clothes were starting to feel tighter. His shirt seemed a size too small for him. His pants, too. It was getting more difficult to walk as they started clinging tighter and tighter, until a loud "Riii-iiip" alerted him that his shirt had gotten torn. And it kept going, as tears appeared all over his shirt, getting bigger as the shirt lost the battle against his growing body. His pants were made of tougher denim, but they couldn't hold out either. His shoes split from top to sole, exposing his growing toes to the air, his socks never stood a chance. Scared and unsure what else to do, Mike tried to unbuckle his pants to relieve the painful pressure, but as he fumbled with them, they began to snap and pop, finally freeing his lower body. As he grew, his clothes were completely shredded and fell off of him. His underwear, with the elastic waistband growing to compensate, but even it couldn't contain his bigger and bigger body, and finally snapped with a 'Twang!', falling off and leaving the poor frightened boy completely naked as he continued to grow. He was now twenty feet tall, and could see that the roof of the house he was standing in front of had some NERF toys stuck on it. Then he shuddered, as his body briefly glowed green, and he shot up to fifty feet tall. Now the top of the house only came up to his naked waist, and he was very frightened. What had happened? What caused this?
Then he remembered the rock. Quickly, he knelt down and searched the rags that had once been his pants, but he couldn't find it. He turned and looked at his right hip, which was were the pocket with the rock had been resting. There was a green mark on his bare skin, and it was already fading. At least he knew what had caused this...
He fell down on his must larger rear end, and looked around, feeling miserable and trying to cover his nakedness.
What could he do now?

Even in the craziness of the situation, Josh realized that he might soon get squashed by his enlarging buddy. Mike also noticed his peril, and tried to keep his bigger self from hurting Josh as he filled the space, but the best he could do was just keep his legs away. As a result, Josh was pressed up against the soft flesh of his friend's package. Soon Mike was breaking through the walls and ceiling, the floor making sounds like it was soon going to collapse. Josh was pressed up against a wall, both he and Mike blushing as they felt what he was being pressed against, although he was grateful that the cock and balls were too soft to crush him, but this was just way too freaky. Finally, the wall behind Mike broke, and he fell tumbling out the back, and staggered to get up, finally crawling to the wreckage to frantically check for his little friend Josh.
"Down here..." The weak voice told him, and he looked down to see that Josh was clinging to his cock, having grabbed on to avoid falling down into the rubble that was half of his house.
Mike...

113.content:
Mike had tried to show Josh the cool rock he'd found, but when he reached into his pocket he couldn't find it. Josh had just laughed it off and teased Mike about 'imaginary rocks'. Mike figured it must have just fallen out, and they spent the rest of the afternoon destroying zombies. He made sure that Josh was coming over for the Big Weekend sleepover at his house, and double-checked with Josh's mom to be sure. Eventually, he hugged Josh goodbye when his curfew rolled around, and walked home. The instant he got inside the house, he was scooped up in a huge pair of arms.
"I gotcha!" Mike recognized the voice and the arms let out a cry of delight.
"Mickey!" It was Mike's big brother Mickey, home from college for the week. He'd volunteered to babysit Mike while their father went on his business trip, and Mike was looking forward to spending a whole seven days with his big brother. Mickey was seven years older than Mike, and 7'3, and probably the coolest brother ever. He didn't think Mike was a pest or acted like he was too cool to play with him, he was always wrestling and tickling and gently teasing him. And he was the reason for the Big Weekend. Since tomorrow was Friday, that meant the Big Weekend could begin as soon as he got home from school the next day! Last time Mickey had cooked them hamburgers and ordered pizza, and they'd played games and watched movies until they couldn't stay up any longer, and Mickey had tucked them in together. He couldn't wait! Mike giggled as his brother pretended to growl and tickled him all over. When he was finally out of breath, Mickey carried him upstairs, tickled him a little more, and then kissed him goodnight.
"Go to sleep, shrimp. Big day tomorrow, remember?" Mickey ruffled his hair, tucked him in, then turned out the light and left him alone. Mike honestly tried to get to sleep, but he was way too excited. It was the Big Weekend! How could a kid sleep knowing it was so close? He squirmed underneath the blanket. Maybe if he just got more comfortable... The lad knew he would be much more comfy if he slept in the nude, even if he would get in trouble if someone found out he did it. Mike knew it was naughty, but if nobody found out, then who would care? Mickey wouldn't barge in on him, and he could just get dressed in the morning... So he began stripping out of his bed-time clothes, starting with his shirt, then his pants, and finally, his underwear.
Ah, that was better...! He wiggled back and forth, enjoying the feeling of the blanket and sheets on his bare skin. Going nude always made him feel so free and happy and comfortable. Mike always liked being naked best, but it was hard to find opportunity. He wound up taking extra-long baths, just enjoying the feeling of having his skin free to the air and water. His dad would scold him when he tried to go naked in the house, and Mickey would just laugh and tell him to put his clothes back on. The downside to being naked was that it left him a unprotected from even the lightest spankings, which his dad and even Mickey gave him to send him scurrying off to get dressed again. Mike pouted in the dark. It wasn't fair. The Big Weekend would be completely perfect if he could be naked along with everything else. For now, he knew he should just get to sleep, and so he sighed and rolled over, easily drifting off now that he didn't have any clothes on.
It was too bad that he was tucked in so tight, otherwise the blanket might have fallen off and showed the green mark on his thigh, the one that glowed and then faded as he fell asleep.
Under the covers, Mike began to grow. It was a process that took hours, so the changes were hardly noticeable to anyone watching. As it was, Mike's young body began to expand, gradually filling up all the space on the bed as he slowly grew too big to stay on it. His leg and arm were soon over the side, and the rest of him followed after a while, the bed creaking and finally being crushed under his increasing weight. He muttered and rolled over when that happened, but did not wake yet. He eventually was sleeping in the fetal position, as his body was now the size of the entire room. When he kept growing after that, he began to awaken, as walls began to break and cracks appeared in the floor. Mickey awoke instantly and ran up to his little brother's room to see what was the matter. To his distress, he couldn't open the door. He had no way of knowing that this was because it was currently being blocked by Mike's bigger and bigger body. Finally, with an alarming crash, the floor gave out, and so did many of the inner walls of the house. Mickey had to struggle back to his feet, and raced downstairs, confronted by the sight of his sleepy, confused, towering naked little brother filling up most of the space in the house.
As Mike began to wake up...
113.title: Mike grows that night

1131.content:
"Mickey?"

Mickey's eyes were glued to the titanic form of his little brother, who at the moment (unbeknownst to Mickey) stood at about 12 feet tall, and had stopped growing for now.

"What happened? Why are you so small?"

Mickey tried to open his mouth to say something, anything, but all that came out was a squeak.

"Mickey?" Mike tried again, to no avail.

The 7th grader veered his legs to face his smaller older brother, and as he sat criss cross in the center of the living room, he distracted himself with all the damage he had caused in his sleep.

"Woah!" Mike said, his voice booming in Mickey's ears.

His hands, which were cradled towards his chest, jutted out to touch the debris that laid hanging around the hole he made.

"Don't -" Mickey tried, his voice rising, but it was too late.

"This must be a dream," Mike said to himself, feeling the rough ridges of the wood he smashed before turning to face his brother.

"At least I'm not the shortest anymore," he teased, to which Mickey shook in fear.

Mike noticed his older brother trembling at the sight of him and placed his oversized hand gently on the side of his face.

"Are you okay?" He asked.

Mickey, who was used to towering over his brother and not one to be intimidated with his muscles, tried to answer:

"I-I'm fine. It's just that...you're huge!"

Mike chuckled, "Yeah. I guess I finally got that growth spurt,"

Mike removed his hand from Mickey as he stretched his legs on either side of him, pushing the couch and the TV in the process.

"Oops-" he said, "good thing this is just a dream, or that would be expensive!"

"A dream?" Mickey asked, staring at the broken items in question.

"Yeah! There's no way I could actually grow like this in real life!"

Mickey paled. His kid brother, the one he had played with for years on end and would never hurt a fly, just destroyed part of the house and thought it was a dream.

"But..." Mickey tried, "you could feel me. And you could also feel the TV and couch. How could this be a dream?"

Mike shrugged, "What else could explain this?"

The boys stayed silent for a bit.

"Welp, there's the answer to that. But now the Big Weekend can begin!" He said, and Mickey shivered.

"Maybe when I wake up I could even tell Mickey about this," he muttered to himself.

"We'll start by..."

11311.content:
Mickey gulped.

"Wrestling? At this size?" He asked, his eyes almost jumping out of their sockets.

"Of course big bro," Mike said, his grin widening, "Or are you too scared?"

Mickey chuckled softly to himself. He had used the same thing when he wrestled his little brother on other weekends. Why should this weekend be any different?

"Alright, alright, you got me," He smirked, and Mike beamed, "but this time I get the handicap, okay?"

The thirteen year old rolled his eyes, "Whatever works, shorty. 5 minute and I don't move."

"As always," The college junior replied, his smirk widening.

"Ready?" They started in unison.

"Set?" Mickey prepared himself with his stance wide and hands open shoulder with apart from his stomach.

"Go!" The voices boomed in unison, as Mickey rushed to find a way to pin the giant down.

He started by running around the gargantuan figure, who was still sitting with his legs stretched out in front of him.

Damn, I'm like a child in comparison to him Mickey thought.

The twenty year old grinned.

Well, Mike is still a child.

"4 minutes!" Mike warned, and Mickey grunted.

He smirked when he saw Mike's arms behind him, stabilizing his torso. If only he could budge them, and make the bigger boy lose his balance. If he was quick enough, he could push all his weight on Mike's torso and pin him to the ground.

Mickey's smirk turned into a grin. He could do this.

Mickey circled around the taller boy for momentum. Mike, who was now studying the ceiling, warned that his brother only had three minutes left before Mike could fight back.

Mickey was breathing heavily when he decided he was ready. With all the force he had, he bulldozed through the limbs that laid behind him, hearing a satisfying "oof" as Mike's torso fell to the ground.

With only a split second to react, the smaller older brother whipped his body around, and aimed to impact on his brother's stomach. When Mickey jumped, he watched as his younger brother's eyes seemed to twinkle at his challenge.

But would it work?

Mickey fell latitudinal on Mike's stomach, to which both boys exhaled softly on impact. Mickey reoriented himself, and with less than two minutes left, scooted to his giant brother's neck.

"So if I straddle your neck and shoulders for ten seconds without you moving, I win, right?"

"Gotta do it quick" Mike said, "you have less than 40 seconds left,"

With haste, the older brother slid to the younger one's neck, pinning it as he would when Mike was smaller.

"1..."

He started counting.

Did he make it?

12.content:
"Bye sis!"

David ran out of the car with his backpack straps lopsided on his shoulders, a wide grin plastered on his face. As he reached the double doors to the school, he took in a deep breath, and was ready to face the day by the time he pushed open the doors. The seventeen year old was halfway through his senior year, and nothing was going to get in his way.

"Good morning David!" the principal greeted as he went to his locker.

"Morning Mr. Gershowitz!" He responded.

The teen quickly flipped through his combination before flinging the locker door open. Today was his easy day, which meant he could go home early.

"Sweet!" He said to himself when he realized this.

"What's up David?"

David turned around and bumped into his friend Jack. Jack was about 6'2, four inches taller than David, but was much skinnier. His maroon skin gleamed in the hallway's fluorescent light, and as David turned around Jack put his calloused hand on his shoulder.

"Ready for gym class, my guy?" He asked with a wink.

"You know I am!" He replied, "See you at the bleachers?"

"Of course!"

As David waved goodbye to his friend, he decided to roam around the halls of the second and third floors, since he had a bit of time left before the bell rang.

He jogged up the stairs and began browsing through the second floor. As he walked around, he'd wave and greet anyone who caught his eye. And, of course, being the guy that he was, everyone would greet him back. He even caught a few girls blushing as he walked by them, which gave his confidence even more of a boost.

By the time he went to the third floor, he was greeting more of the underclassmen, but that didn't seem to stop him. In fact, a lot of his friends like Jake were also underclassmen - their ages didn't matter so much to him.

As he wrapped up his journey on the third floor, he heard a conversation coming from some freshman that piqued his interest.

"Did you hear about what's happening on the fourth floor?"

David paused. We don't have a fourth floor, he thought to himself. He kept listening.

"Yeah, I have. Apparently there's a pool and everything."
"What's a fourth flo-"
"Shhh!"

The huddle of underclassmen started whispering. If there was a fourth floor, these guys sure did believe it existed.

David went closer to their huddle.

"How do you reach the fourth floor?"

The freshmen jumped as David gave them a friendly smile.

"Err, well..." This one girl, Amy, stammered, "Apparently you need one of the elevator keys to get to it..."

Amy turned pink as David patted her on her shoulder.

"Thanks!"

A boy in the circle pitched in, "We think it's a new STEM lab, but don't tell anyone! I don't think it'll be ready 'til next year!"

"Will do, Brad. Thanks!"

The warning bell rang overhead.

"Welp, that's my cue! Bye guys!"

"Bye David!"
12.title: David's Trip to the Fourth Floor

choices: Uh Oh! We've got other problems!
121.content:
David barely made it in the nick of time. Jake laughed at him as he stumbled over to the bleachers.

"How rough were the locker rooms?" He asked.

"Cody asked me about Rachel's panties. Again."

Jake laughed.

"The man only thinks with his dick!" He hollered.

"Good thing Trevor covered me when I left,"

"Heh, yeah."

David walked up the bleachers and sat next to his friend.

"Hey Jake?"

Jake turned, "hmm?"

"Do you wanna do something a bit...different for me?"

"Whaddya mean?"

"Well," David started, "Apparently there's a fourth floor in the works, and I kinda wanna see it after this period's over,"

"A fourth floor?" Jake wheezed, "Have you been hangin' with the freshies again?"

"Yea...well, no, that's not the point," he said, as Jake rolled his eyes.

"The point is I need an elevator key, and I know you have it in with Ms. Nalu, so if you could get one for me -"

Jake snorted, "You've really done it this time. Besides, you could do it just as well as I, and I'm pretty sure there isn't one to begin with,"

The tips of David's ears turned pink, "Aww, c'mon dude! You know I gotta ask Mr. Rogers if I can skip. Besides, you didn't think I was going there all by myself, didja?"

Jake smirked, "Good point."

"And stop calling them freshies, a couple months ago you still were one."

Jake shrugged, "Agree to disagree."

Right then, the P.E teacher sounded her whistle. The two boys stood and raced down to the gymnasium floor, where it turned out they'd be playing Jake's personal favorite - dodgeball. As the gymnasium filled with the sounds of bouncy balls hitting walls, floors, and even other people, David still couldn't help but get the fourth floor off his mind.

At last, Jake and Cody were the only ones left for their respective teams, David being the last one out before the showdown.

"You can't avoid me forever, my guy," Cody teased as he gripped the red balls in his hands tighter.

"For someone who only has one thing on his mind 24/7, dodgeball sure comes easy to you," Jake kidded, his hands empty.

Cody got his pitching hand ready, and hurled the first ball towards Jake's torso. Jake dodged to the left, and managed to grab the ball in midair as it bounced off the wall. Cody took his moment of haste as an opportunity and threw his other ball, sailing closer to Jake's head, as he barely managed to suck as the ball hissed above him.

Cody cursed silently to himself. There were so many balls on Jake' side, and he had thrown his last one. Jake took his moment of vulnerability to throw two jet-fast balls, one to Cody's left and one to Cody's right. As Cody squeezed his way between the two, Jake snatched up another ball that set it's course towards Cody's torso.

BEEP! BEEP! BEEP! BEEP! BEEP!

The ball hit Cody's abdomen as the bell rang for the end of first period. Jake's team cheered as he basked in the glory of their last target being hit. As both teams cleaned up the balls, Jake made his way to David.

"You were great out there, man!" David said with a smirk.

"What can I say? I fend pretty well for myself."

The two chuckled.

"So, I'll see you in study hall?" Jake asked.

"What?"

"The fourth floor, dude. I'm coming with."

"Awesome!"

As David waved a temporary goodbye to Jake after the both of them changed, he made his way to his next class - Literature. Except this time, like many, he wasn't going to stay in that class.

"Mr.Rogers?" David asked, putting his backpack on his desk.

"No need, David! I already told you, since you took the test early you could go to the study hall until we take it in two classes."

David smiled, as he slugged his backpack on his back.

"Thanks Mr.Rogers!"

"Don't mention it."

As the bell for second period rang, David raced from the third floor to the first, where he found his friend Jake waiting with the key around his lanyard.

"What took you so long?" He joked.

"You know I'm on the third floor!"

"Touché."

The two boys, with the slips from the Study Hall, made their way to the elevator.

"Odd, I hadn't seen that button before," Jake said as he pressed the "4" button.

"Must be new," David smirked.

The sophomore sighed, "Y'know, I hate when you're right sometimes."

"Score one for the freshmen."

"Whatever."

But as he turned around to get back into the elevator...

13.content:
Bill was sitting in his office, staring at the computer screen. How he wished he was home right now. He had been bored ever since he stepped foot in this building. He looked around his desk, wanting to look at something other than a screen. His eyes fell on a picture of him and his two sons, Henry and Matt. Henry, who was ten, had bright red hair and Matt, who was 15, had shaggy black hair. Bill was smiling and Henry and Matt were making goofy faces. Bill was proud of his sons. Unlike his co-workers kids, Matt and Henry got along really well and hardly ever argued. He was so proud of his boys and hoped they wouldn't end up in a dumb ass job that he was in.

He always wished that something would come along that would change his life. Hell, winning the lottery would send him bouncing off of the walls. Sure, he was making a good amount of money, but he didn't really have a fun time doing it.

"Bill". Bill snappe dout of his daydream and looked up to see his co-worker Daniel standing in the doorway. Daniel was one of Bills closest friends.

"Hey Daniel, what's up?" Bill asked.

"Just wanted to let you know, this came for you a couple of minutes ago". Daniel handed Bill a green envelope

"Thanks Dan". Daniel nodded and headed out. Bill was confused about what this letter was. He didn't order anything and most of his mail was sent to his house.

He laid back in his chair, putting his hands on his gut, deciding what to do. he finally opened it and was greeted with three small packs of green powder. There was also a note inside. Bill pulled it out and read:

"Heard you wanted a BIG change in your life. Take one of these and watch you r dreams come true. As for the other two packs, you can decide what to do with them. Maybe let your sons have a BIG change too? Just mix the powder in a drink and have fun."

That was it. No name or return address, Bill knew it had to be someone who knew him or they wouldn't have known about his sons or that he was bored out of his mind at his job. But how come he had never seen the handwriting before?

14.content:
Steven yawned as he stumbled out of bed. Today was just like any other day on campus, boring and monotonous. Deep down he really just wished something new would happen to break the cycle of everyday.

He hear his phone buzz to life next to him. He picked it up and saw it was his boyfriend, Chad, texting him to remind him to stop by the Chem lab and pick up his project for him.

Stumbling out the door, Steven looked to the sky. Same as always, slightly cloudy and sunny. He waled over to the Chemab and swiped himself in. From there he began searching for Chad's project.

"Man I'm a Political Science major, I should not be allowed in here. Where is his lab again?" Steven opened a door and flicked on the light. "Man they run so many wires in here it's amazing no one trips and dies." He carefully weaved his way around the wires and desks until he came to a shelf with vials on it marked 'Chad'. He reached to grab them but they were just a hair too far.

"Of course Chad's 6''2' self would shove them so high. C'mon!" He jumped a little, shaking the shelf and spilling the contents of Vhad's project all over himself.

"Damn damn damn damn!" Steven sweated as he stood up, trying to use his shirt to clean his face. As he struggled to brace himself he grabbed an exposed sure, sending and electric shock through his body. He fell over, unconscious.

When he woke up he found himself in a nearby hospital, with Chad looming worriedly over him. It sent a surge of warmth through Steven's heart to see the muscular, short blonde haired guy, and knowing that he cared about him more than the smashed project.

"Steve! Are you ok?" Chad asked in a rush. "Yeah I'm fine. I think..." "I'm just a little worried, those vials haven't been tested on mammals before and they definitely haven't been exposed to electricity." "I'm sure I'll be fine."
14.title: Steven

choices: Chad and/or Steven dreams that night...
142.content:
With nothing immediately wrong, the doctor figured that Steven was likely safe to go home, though they should call the hospital if anything changes.

The car ride back to their apartment was mostly silent; Chad's mind was racing with what could possibly happen to Steven, who was replaying what had happened in his head. Eventually, Steven spoke up. "So, what exactly was that stuff?" Chad fidgeted his hands on the steering wheel, before taking a deep breath. He looked over to Steven, who was staring out at the road, more curious than worried. Chad slumped in his seat as he turned his head back to the road.

"What do you know about hormones?" Steven shook his head. "Right, right. PolySci, not Biomed." He sighed again before continuing. "We were specifically looking at hormones that dictate growth, muscle development, bone growth, even body fat accumulation. Mostly how to fix them when they aren't working. What spilled all over you was a formula to essentially kickstart the given hormones into working." Steven remained silent for a while, as Chad turned the wheel in order to drive into their apartment's lot. Chad grabbed both of their things, letting Steven grab the keys to their apartment.

Once inside, Steven thought about what Chad had said. He wanted to know more about what it was. "Did it work?" Steven wasn't sure whether he was more curious or afraid of the answer. He sat down on the living room futon waiting for Chad's response.

Chad set their things down, sitting next to Steven on the futon. "We haven't tested on anything other than mice, but it did what it was supposed to do. Sometimes it even exceeded what we had hoped for." Chad was beginning to get excited over his research - he was rather proud of it, after all - before realizing that hearing what a technical wonder the formula was, probably wasn't what Steven wanted to hear. "Don't worry, though!" Chad continued, sheepishly trying to comfort his boyfriend. "Even though I'm not sure which formula you got on you, you'll definitely be fine. The electricity probably rendered it inert anyways. It-"

"Wait." Steven interrupted, eyebrows raised quizzically. "You seriously don't even know what you were having me grab for you?"

"Steven, I'm sorry." Chad was becoming increasingly upset for letting something happen to one of the people he cared the most for. "I shouldn't have had you get my things, and I hate myself for letting you get hurt. We switch around what each member of the team is working on, so I really don't know what got on you. But I do know you'll be okay." He looked back at Steven. "And if something does happen, I swear, I will do everything to fix it."

"I'm not worried. Actually, you're worrying more than I am." Steven smiled. "Even if anything happens, I know you're more than capable of making it better." He leaned over, sitting up in order to give his boyfriend a peck on the cheek.

Steven waved to Chad as he got off of the futon. "Anyways, I'm gonna get some sleep before I turn into a giant rat monster." Chad jumped, causing Steven's smile to turn into outright laughter. "Jeez, I'm joking. Love you, you dumb scientist." With that, Steven went down the hall to their shared bedroom.

Chad stayed out on the futon, even though his boyfriend didn't care, he was pretty distressed. Honestly, there was no telling what would happen. Did the electricity dampen it, or would it amplify the effects? Would there be any effect at all? Chad curled up on the futon, dozing off, concerned.

He’s the only child of the family, which meant he had to to share some bond with his parents, while also hanging out with his friends everywhere he was at. Even though he doesn’t mind with his gluttonous size which he’s a great football player as a defense, his biggest love in all was if he can be a giant, like being as tall as the buildings of the city.

This is because when he was young, he took upon watching the film named “Honey, I Blew Up The Kid!” where a toddler had been shot through a machine and everything electric he touches makes him grew bigger and have some fun in the city. This has fascinated Jack ever since and he would always admired of himself being one, if it only happens in real by any chance.

That may be true in those scenarios, when Jack was sitting on the couch, watching the TV with snacks by his side. He was pretty much relaxed when he heard the doorbell ringing, and Jack quickly got up to answer the door. But by opening the door, he could only see no one was standing at the doorstep, and thought he was giving himself a big sigh. However before he would even shut the door, he looked down and realised there’s some kind of parcel being left there.

“Huh, what’s this doing over here?” Jack wondered in confusion.

He didn’t know where or how did it came from, but whatever it was lying here, it was going to be his by any means. So he shrugged and carries the parcel in the house and shut the door behind him. He then went to the couch to place it there and opened up to see what was inside. His eyes went wide, but also looked a bit confused when he was able to brought an item out of the box, and takes a look to what it was.

“That’s strange! I don’t know I even asked for this, but this looks interesting.” Jack had some thoughts for the moment, when he had inspected an item itself.

It looks of if it’s some kind of a size changer or something, hence he would realised the labeled tag on its item. But the question by looking at it is what kind is it?
1551.title: Jack and the strange parcel

1552.content:
"Wow, I wished that would happen to me," Matt said to himself.

"What's that?" his Dad asked.

"Nothing," Matt said.

"Humph," his Dad answered. Looking up at the clock, then at the television, his Dad answered, "Well, movie is over, it's late, and time for bed. Night Matt."

"Night, Dad."

Matt headed up the stairs, depressed. He had just watched an old movie called Big, where a kid his age made a wish and grew into an adult over night. Matt like the movie, though he didn't know why the kid wanted to go back to being young again. I mean, he got to live like he wanted, and got to play with toys for a living, and he got to play with BOOBS!!!

Matt had just started getting interested in the opposite sex, and was paying particular attention to the girls in his grade who were developing, especial in the chest. But being the shortest guy in his class wasn't conducive to getting to know the early developers better. Worse yet, Matt's Dad was IT savvy, so Matt never got to use the internet to learn more about the fascinating world of BOOBS!!! In fact, if Matt had been awake during the scene where Tom Hanks fondled Elizabeth Perkins' bra clad breasts, he would have probably turned the television off followed by an uncomfortable talk with Matt.

"I wish I was big," Matt muttered to himself before climbing into bed and falling fast asleep.

----

The next morning Matt woke up, feeling strange. Maybe...maybe his wish had come true!

He quickly ran to the bathroom and looked into the mirror to discover that...

Nothing had changed. Nothing at all. He wasn't older. He wasn't bigger. The old pajamas he had gone to bed with still fit just fine. He was still Matt, the shortest guy in his class.

Sighing, Matt trudged back to his room. And almost fainted.

In the middle of his room was floating flat screen television, with a man's face taking up the screen.

"How are you feeling, Matt?" the man asked.

"Uh, fine," Matt said. Matt looked around at the rest of his room, then back at the screen. "I'm dreaming, aren't I?"

"No, you're quite wide awake," the man on the screen said. "But the world you went to sleep in didn't have technology like this, did it?"

Matt thought he should be freaking out, be he wasn't. He wasn't convinced he wasn't dreaming, but dream or not, nothing seemed to be threatening.

"You said in my world," Matt began. "You mean this is a different world?"

The face on the floating television screen nodded. "Our world is similar to yours, except the inhabitants of our world are approximately an eleventh of the size of the inhabitants of your world."

"Whoa, wait a minute, you mean like Lilliput?" Matt asked, suddenly remembering his wish to be Big; He must be dreaming. "So that would make me a giant in your world. But...well, you look like my size."

"Just an illusion," the man on the screen said. "Because your mind doesn't expect people significantly smaller than yourself, you assume that I'm your size."

Matt nodded. "So, um, how did I get in your world?"

"We brought you here," the man answered simply. "It is your fourteenth birthday, isn't it?"

Matt nodded. It was his birthday today. "So, did you bring me to your world for a reason?"

"Our world has always had a gentle giant to watch over it. Even in modern times, when our world is united and our technology is advanced and we really don't need a giant, we still bring one over. And it is always a gentle being who wants to be big. So on the event of his fourteenth birthday, we bring him to our world."

"Wow!" was all Matt had to say. He looked around and said, "So, you brought my bedroom as well?"

The man shook his head. "We constructed a duplicate of your room, so that you would feel more comfortable. We know it will take time to adjust to your new setting. And we have a guide. Are you ready to meet her?"

Now Matt was sure this was a dream. But it sure felt real. He nodded, and the screen disappeared.

"Yep, this is a dream," Matt said. "I should be waking up at any minute."

"Hey you, over here," a tiny voice shouted. Matt turned around and his jaw dropped. Standing on his desk was a six inch...
1552.title: Matt

choices: Want to spend time with Kiel?
155332.content:
Kiel Height-1500 ft. Age-14
Kiel is an alien that landed on a deserted island by shuttle fourteen years ago. He has blue hair, purple eyes, long pointed ears, and his only article of clothing are a pair of silver lined blue skin-tight shorts that only reach halfway to his knees. His height triples every year and has led to him becoming very noticeable by the outside world so he is under constant surveillance by the government and has become a tourist attraction.
155332.title: Something more fantasy...

choices: He looked up to the crowed...
1553321.content:
Kiel, a being that landed on an island off the cost of Hawaii fourteen years ago. The shuttle, which was more like a dissolving capsule, he landed in was hidden by cloaking and landed without a sound or notice under any optical surveillance. The island he stayed in was small and was abandoned due to its constant flooding since the nightly high tide practically drowned the island. It was the perfect place to hide him, until he grew. His growth rate makes his size triple every year. This eventually led to his discovery two years ago when he was around 166 ft. tall.

He's now at a staggering height of nearly 1500 ft. His body can no longer be held in the confines of the island, but the government refuses to move him to a different location. Battle ships, helicopters, and planes ready to bomb him are constantly shifting to his area then being replaced by the next watch team. During the night he has search lights blinding his view on all sides as. As a final measure if necessary, an H-Bomb was placed into his heart and another along his spine connecting to his brain, as a final resort if he needed to be subdued and the President agreed to do so. If his height reached beyond 10,000 ft. it was agreed that the bombs would be detonated.

But none of them cared that he was not the type to hurt another living being. His heart beat the same as everyone on this planet, even if it could fit a person within it. He knew exactly what it meant to die. A few animals that survived the constant flooding shared their food with him, although he did not need to eat. They stayed in a cave along a small mountain on the island. During his stay one night he had already grown to the point he could barely fit in the opening to the cave. He was going through another growth spurt when a bird laying on his back which grazed against the ceiling was crushed between the two surfaces. This bird taught him to sing with the morning sunrise and to whistle in a language all with feathered wings knew.

He was very handsome for a humanoid alien. He had shoulder length spiky blue hair that was tougher than most metals, but softer than downed pillows. His eyes were violet with small white splotches and dots. He was well built and somehow his body was able to maintain and increase in muscle mass even though he did not need to eat. One main part of him that did make him apart from the average human is the fact that he had long pointed ears that reached back behind his head. The only article of clothing he wore was a silver lined, skin-tight, blue pair of shorts that reached half-way to his knees with a black mark running down each side. Scientists were not sure how it could increase with his size, they did know that the material was indestructible after many tests. The only reason they called him Kiel was because his name was marked in silver letters along the lining on the back.

Scientists were brought to him as soon as he was discovered and maintained, although he did not put in much of a struggle. His blood type was called the 'Secondary 0' as it could be used in any transfusion including Bombay blood. His brain waves were on par with some of the most intelligent minds in history. And although his size increased beyond any natural level, which still cannot be explained, his weight does not impact his surroundings. At his current weight he could topple a building yet his weight is halted when he is just about to destroy an object or organism. Trees bend but never break under him and his footsteps are soundless. Scientists and high ranking officers know this, but the lower grunts and civilians do not; as Kiel's size increases so does his hearing. For now he is able to hear everything within a 37 mile radius. He can hear every little conversation and can listen in on selected ones while fading out others. He was also able to see better a great distance away and focus in on the smallest of details. With his eyes closed he's even able to see the outlines of what people are shaped like by listening to the vibrations around them, 'three people live in that house, a couple and their new baby. I'm glad they're happy.' He used to silently cry under his arms when hearing some of the hurtful or inappropriate things, but he ignores them now.

For now Kiel is carefully biding his time and hoping for someone to take pity on him or just listen to him. To try and know him for something more than what doesn't belong. Maybe as someone who others can possibly depend on. He doesn't want to destroy or kill, he wants to belong.

Recently his hopes have been answered. The government has posted him as 'Until further notice, Harmless'. He heard this over a radio station he listened to the waves of. The ships that survey him are going to start round trip tours of him as they circle the island and switch. As if the cameras and satellites were not enough. But, the reason he was beginning to brighten his mood was that they were allowing other kids his age to come to the island and see him.

...

That radio announcement was a week and a half ago. Kiel was in his usual position siting on the small stretch of land with his knees bent in and his arms wrapped around his legs. He listened to the birds singing on his hand as a scientist, or more preferably his doctor, checked him. "Spread out your leg Kiel...Kiel...spread your legs out..." a man in a blue coat with a writing pad commanded from the deck of a nearby ship.

"Huh! Oh...sorry doctor Mick..." he let his leg out.

"Ah, another 17 feet until your fourteenth birthday it seems," he tried to joke as he jotted down on his notepad. Kiel gave a meek smile as he pulled his leg back under his arms. "The third tour is today, not many came yesterday and the day before, but maybe you'll be lucky today."

"...I hope so..." Kiel spoke quietly to himself, his eyes gleaming with a sad and distant wish.

"Let's go everyone, I'm done with my analysis...bye Kiel."

"Bye, bye, doctor Mick." The boat went back to shore as the usual ships went around.

It was almost four which meant the hour long tour would come soon. Four tour boats will sail between the sixteen army boats and stare at Kiel, take pictures, and comment. Some mean, some sexual, some destructive, but only from the ones he wanted to be friends with would he hear piteous. On the first day of the tours no one said anything and he could clearly see every single person on each boat. Most of them still came the second day, but this time were less afraid. And now it was hopefully the day he would hear one kind word from them.

He was a little afraid of females because they were the ones that said more inappropriate things, although not the most inappropriate compared to some of the really scary men. He knew who would try to take advantage of him. He also didn't want to spend time with someone older than him because he didn't want them to feel uncomfortable. So he was directed to one group of people, those around his age and were also boys. He had one person in particular he was sure would be the one he'd want to connect with. He had been on the tours since the first day. And he heard him talk before with his friends at school about how sorry he felt for him. Out of the corner of his eye Kiel could see the sorry look the boy hid from the adults...
1553321.title: The lonely E.T.

choices: Kiel knows that this is the boy he wants to be friends with.
Kiel is still unsure, and wants to observe some more.
15533211.content:
"Look at that FREAK!" a tall, chunky redheaded boy called out from the lower balcony of the boat, sneering and pointing a long, skinny finger towards the enormous figure sitting on the island.

"Yeah!" his shorter and thinner blonde-haired friend agreed. "Have you ever seen anything like him?"

"Nope." the redhead shook his head. "He almost looks like something out of a bad 50's sci-fi TV show."

"Or one of those stupid role-playing games," the blonde boy suggested. "Either way, he's certainly weird. Why do you think he's so big?"

"Beats me," Redhead shrugged. "Hey, what do you think he does when he has to take a dump?"

Blondie started smirking. "Probably just pulls down those stupid blue shorts of his and squats over the ocean." He started laughing derisively at his example of juvenile humor. "I'm glad I'm not a fish!"

"Whatever the case," Redhead said as a crooked smile started to form across his face, "he's not natural, that's for sure."

"You're right," Blondie nodded, "I hear he's not even from Earth! That's why he's a FREAK!" The boy climbed up on the second rail, leaning his torso out over the water as far as he could go. He cupped his hands around his mouth, yelling at the top of his lungs, "YOU HEAR THAT? GO BACK TO WHEREVER YOU CAME FROM!"

"YEAH!" His pudgy friend had joined him, one sneakered foot on the railing and another sticking out in the air behind him. "GET OUT OF OUR COUNTRY AND OFF OF OUR PLANET, YOU GIANT ALIEN FREAK!"

"Jason!" a squat middle-aged woman called down from the upper deck, where her and the other school group parents who were acting as chaperones on this trip were watching the boys from while lying on a series of deck chairs, absorbing the sun using reflectors. "Get down from that railing or you'll fall off into the ocean! Besides, you're way too far away; that boy can't hear you."

Standing back from the group of jeering boys, a moderately-tall, athletically-built olive-skinned boy leaned against the wall of the boat and watched his classmates (he no longer called them his "friends") make complete fools of themselves. Jonah had listened intently to last week's radio broadcast and knew that what the chaperone said was wrong, that Kiel, the giant boy, could actually hear each individual comment that was being said on any of the ships circling the island, as well as pinpoint the exact person saying it, using his unbelievable eagle-eye vision.

None of it made any logical sense; it was all beyond any current human comprehension, Jonah knew. That's why he had been looking forward to this school trip so much ever since six weeks ago when his teachers had said they would spend a week visiting Ko Pilikua Moena ("The Giant's Bed", as Kiel's island had come to be known since his discovery). He wanted to meet the giant boy, perhaps get the chance to talk to him and learn more about his kind. If he was lucky enough, he might even discover what was going on inside his continuously growing body that had caused all this in the first place.

But the trip had not been as enjoyable as Jonah had hoped it would be. First of all, the school chaperones immediately decided against bringing the ships to the shore, demanding that the ship's captain only circle the island at a circumference of no closer than 500 yards. Jonah felt torn apart inside; he was closer than nearly any other civilian (certainly any kid or teenager) had ever gotten to the giant, close enough to see the details of his form and hear his breathing and his surprisingly quiet voice, but he was not close enough. He might as well have been watching Kiel on a television special, sitting on his couch back home in Honolulu.

Adding to Jonah's disappointment was the fact that every one of the other boys in the class had come to a consensus that they should mock the poor giant endlessly, taunting him however they could and making fun of his appearance at every opportunity. Even the adults on the ship, when they thought none of the kids were around, whispered hurtful or incredibly offensive statements to each other concerning Kiel. Jonah had heard one of these comments, and he felt like crying because of it.

The only time that Jonah spoke up in defense of Kiel, the other boys immediately seized the opportunity to single him out, making fun of him and calling him an "alien-lover" and "mini-Freak". One particularly foul-mouthed boy even suggested that Jonah had a secret desire to the giant boy to scoop him up and use him as a sex-toy. Jonah had fairly thick skin, he thought, and he didn't take their insults directed towards him very seriously, knowing that they were just being stupid, immature jerks. But he couldn't help but continue to feel sorry for the massive boy they were mocking, wondering how it must feel to live all alone in a world that continuously shrank around him, not having any friends or family to support him anywhere on the planet. Kiel's situation seemed incredibly sad to Jonah, and at the same time made him want to meet the boy all the more.

Redhead and Blondie wrapped up their yelling and jumped down from the railing. "C'mon," Redhead said, motioning for his friend to follow, "let's go inside, downstairs to the room with the glass floor on bottom deck of the boat. We might be able to see if he's left any trash or whatever in the water."

"Yeah!" his blonde friend agreed. "I bet we'll see huge petrified turds on the ocean floor! Or something like that."

As the obnoxious boys ran off, heading to the interior of the ship, Jonah closed his eyes and sighed, dismayed by the incredible levels of immaturity they had displayed. "Am I the only boy in the entire freshman class who doesn't think jokes about fecal matter are funny?" he thought to himself. At least they were gone, and he was alone on the lower balcony now. He walked up to the same railing where the two boys had been standing and gently leaned against it.

Brushing aside the thick black hair that had fallen into his eyes again, he looked out across the surface of the water towards the island, watching keenly as the giant boy sat there, doing nothing, apparently. Jonah could make out the lean, rippling muscles in Kiel's upper body and his powerful, sequoia-like legs. Even from this far a distance, Jonah got the impression that the giant had a tender demeanor and attitude, and that he always tried to carefully avoid intruding on any animal or plants on his island, even in addition to the mystical powers that kept his large size from hurting anyone or anything.

But, as Jonah continued to watch Kiel, the one thing that he felt more than anything was how lonely the giant looked. He sat silently, his thick arms wrapped around his knees and his eyes barely open, seemingly on the verge of tears. Sometimes a bird or small mammal would start to climb on his foot, and he'd carefully pick them up and bring them towards his face, murmuring something softly as he did. This was the closest he ever came to smiling, his eyes lighting up if only for a second. But the animals would always end up flying away or scurrying off, leaving Kiel all alone again.

Jonah propped his chin up with his arm as he continued to lean against the railing. "What a poor, noble soul," he thought to himself. "I can't imagine how I'd survive so alone, so far away from my home and all the people I know and love. I wish I could be there, walking around on the island. I wish I could talk to him..." Damn those stupid chaperones and their rash decision to restrict the group from visiting the island itself. As Jonah looked at his watch, realizing it was almost time for the ships to leave for the day, he consoled himself with the fact that his school group still had two more days of tours left, and that he still had a few more opportunities to observe the giant.
15533211.title: Unlike The Other Boys

choices: That night back in the hotel with Jonah.
Kiel tries to keep his spirits up by chatting with the animals on the island.
155332111.content:
Kiel had watched all this unfold, sitting down in his usual spot on the highest point of the island. He did his best to ignore the hurtful comments of the ignorant boys and close-minded adults, but their negativity and their hostility did get to him, at least a little bit.

There was something different about this time, though. Something that stirred a feeling inside him, a feeling of... what was it again? Hope? It had been so long since he had felt that way about anything in his life. But here, on one of these ships, above all the insults, jeers and screaming of a thousand detractors, Kiel detected a single quiet, contemplative voice, one that spoke with optimism, with a sense of longing.

"I wish I could talk to him..."

It may not have seemed like much, but these words represented the exact kind of sentiment that Kiel had been looking and hoping for all this time. He narrowed his vision, scanning the row of tour boats out in the distance, and identified the source of the one positive statement: the smooth, somewhat-rounded face of a teenaged boy who leaned against a railing on the lower balcony of the ship he was on. Based on the boy's facial features and skin tone, Kiel quickly determined that the boy had to be Japanese-American in origin, perhaps with some native Hawaiian thrown in there as well. He seemed around the same age as Kiel, maybe a few months older, a year at most. He stood around 5' 10", making him a little taller than most of the other boys in his group, though not enough to make any sort of real difference to Kiel himself.

What probably captured Kiel's attention the most, however, was how inquisitive and interested the boy seemed to be. He didn't shout or yell like the other boys, or run around crazily, or make jokes. Instead, he waited for the rest of the boys to leave before really saying much of anything at all. As Kiel looked at the boy, he realized that he had actually been on the boat during both of the first two days of the tours, and remembered that the other boys had called him Jonah (along with some other not-so-nice names that Kiel had chosen to ignore). He didn't remember hearing much of anything from him then, perhaps a quiet word of protest. At the time Kiel had wondered why the boy had not joined in with the others, but this explained it. Like Kiel, Jonah was gentle, not wanting to attack or make fun of something (or someone) he didn't comprehend, but instead having a burning desire to explore and become more understanding of them.

Kiel got lost in contemplation, and the sound of the tour boats blasting their horns startled him. The horns blew three long tones, signaling that the tour ships were about to leave the area and head back to the harbor. Kiel quickly snapped back to the situation at hand, and when he realized what was happening, he began to feel sad that the boats were leaving. Had they already been here for an hour, he wondered.

A powerful feeling suddenly built up inside Kiel's heart, surprising the giant with its intensity and its urgency. He now realized that he had to give Jonah some sort of signal, some indication that Kiel had picked up his good intentions and knew that they were like-hearted souls. He racked his brain, trying to think of something he could possibly do to demonstrate this, but absolutely nothing came to mind.

Finally, with no other ideas, Kiel decided to just turn his head and look directly at Jonah, making eye contact with him. He figured that the boy probably wouldn't think someone as big as Kiel could possibly be looking directly at him and him alone, but he could come up with nothing else. Kiel did his best to convey a sense of friendliness in his expression and a desire for the two of them to meet and talk. For a moment, he thought he saw Jonah's eyes widen, and his mouth begin to open, possibly about to say something. But just at that moment, the ship abruptly changed directions, turning around and speeding off into the distance, back to the island of Kauai where it had departed from, several dozen miles away.

Sighing, Kiel turned his eyes back to his own island and looked down at the ground. He bent his head in between his knees and wrapped his hands behind his neck, softly sobbing as his enormous body bobbed up and down, ever so slightly. Another day had come and gone, and nothing had changed. He still was growing out of control. He still heard the hurtful mocking of thousands of people daily. And he still was just as alone as ever.
155332111.title: He's The One

choices: The next day, Jonah's group returns to the island.
A storm hits, and Kiel is left all alone for the entire day.
1553321111.content:
"I swear, Cory," Jonah exclaimed into his cell phone, his voice getting faster and higher in tone as he got more and more excited, "he was looking directly at me! Me and me alone! I could just... feel it--- in his eyes!"

A second's pause preceded his older brother's slightly lower-pitched, monotone voice, and the single-word question it asked: "Who?"

Jonah stopped pacing around the hotel room, smacking his forehead with his hand. "Who?! Who have we been talking about for the last fifteen minutes, Cory? Who's been on the local news every week for the past two years? Who's the whole reason my class went on a trip to Kauai in the first place?!"

More silence answered him. "Uhhh..."

"It's Kiel, Cory," Jonah groaned in frustration, a little surprised at his brother's display of either ignorance or forgetfulness. "The fifteen-hundred-foot tall boy with the long blue hair. Remember?"

"Oh!" Cory's voice suddenly clicked in recollection. "Oh yeah, I forgot that's where you guys were going. Sorry about that." Through the phone, Jonah could hear the sound of computer keys clicking away at an incredibly fast pace.

"Cory," he grinned and shook his head, "can't you do the polite thing and get off of the computer for even a few minutes, so you can properly talk to your favorite little brother?"

"You're my only little brother," Cory reminded him. "And no, I can't. I've got a big assignment for my Java class due in two hours. It's worth a quarter of my grade, and I still need to finish writing four subroutines, scan for any possible bugs, and pray to God it all compiles."

Jonah chuckled. "Okay, fine, I'll give you a pass." He wasn't surprised. As smart and as talented a programmer as Cory was, he wouldn't be Cory if he weren't scrambling to complete some major project at the very last minute. The same kinda thing at the end of his senior year almost kept him from passing physics (and, thus, graduating from high school), and, though few in his family dared to bring it up, everyone knew that lack of preparation and scrambling to meet deadlines were the two main reasons why he had been rejected by Stanford, MIT, and UC-Berkley, and forced to attend Hawaii Pacific University, his safety school, despite getting a 1580 on the SAT. Though Cory maintained that he had wanted to be close to home anyways (and Jonah was certainly glad to have him stay in Honolulu), and HPU had a reasonably decent computer science program that Cory seemed to be doing well in, Jonah knew that his older brother's ambitions were certainly higher than just staying in the Islands all his life.

"Anyways," Cory talked as he continued to type away, "how exactly do you know that this mega boy was looking at you specifically? Weren't there something like a dozen other tour boats right around yours? Not to mention the Navy and Coast Guard."

"Only four touring ships," Jonah answered, exhaling a little, "and the military ships kept their distance the entire time. I can't say for sure why I know he was looking at me, Cory. I just know that he was. I sensed it, felt it in every part of my body. And you want to know something else? He's an extraordinarily kind person. He wouldn't-- actually, no, he COULDN'T hurt even a fly. He's just lonely; he needs a friend or two."

"Well," Cory said, "I'm not sure exactly how a fifteen-hundred-foot tall boy befriends anyone. But I guess even a giant like him could use a buddy."

"Exactly." Jonah paused, stepping out onto the second-floor balcony of the hotel room, looking down onto the beach below. The waves of the ocean gently washed upon the shore below, the waters as calm as he'd seen in weeks. Looking out towards the horizon, he knew that Kiel's island was only thirty or so miles away, off to the northeast. There had to be a way for him to get out there. It was certainly too far to swim, even for someone as experienced as he was, but maybe... If he just could get his hands on something like-- like a small motorboat, perhaps the ones that he had seen for rent back at Nawiliwili Harbor... He pictured himself sailing across the waters of the Pacific, the wind at his back, soon coming ashore on the giant's island, much to the big boy's surprise... If he put his mind to it, Jonah knew he could make it.

"Jonah? Are you listening?"

Jonah snapped back to the conversation, unaware that Cory had gone on talking while he had been lost in his imagination. "Uh... yeah. I'm here, Cory. Sorry about that."

Gentle laughter filled his ears. "Now look who's not paying attention to his favorite older brother." In his mind Jonah saw Cory's bright, wide smile as his brother leaned forward and playfully mussed his hair. The thought made him feel a little better.

"You're my only older brother," Jonah reminded him.

"Didn't I just use that line not even five minutes ago?"

"Maayyyybeee..." Jonah smirked as he blushed a little. "But you know what? You're still my favorite."

"Thanks, buddy," Cory said, his voice warm and appreciative. "I hope you have fun tomorrow. Do you think they'll finally let you go scuba diving?"

Jonah's eyes suddenly lit up. "Oh yeah! They said they'd let anyone who was certified get in the water tomorrow. I think me and a couple of other guys and girls are planning on it. I'd almost forgotten."

"Sounds like fun. Just don't go and swim too close to the island. Kiel might just reach out and scoop you out of the water."

Jonah rolled his eyes. If only, he thought. "I'll keep that in mind. Good night, Cory."

"Night."

Jonah flipped shut his phone and shoved it into the front pocket of his jeans. As he leaned against the balcony rail, a sudden gust of wind came up from the ocean, blowing his hair back into his eyes. Jonah just stood and absorbed the wind, wondering if that same gust might have travelled all the way from Kiel's island, if it had circulated through his two massive lungs, exhaled by the boy before making its way across the sea. It didn't really matter, Jonah realized, but the thought stirred something inside of him, a feeling he couldn't quite place a finger on. The only thing he knew was that he liked it.

The sound of the hotel room door flying open interrupted his thoughts. Jonah turned around to see several boys, including the loud, obnoxious jock he had been forced to share a room with this week, stumble in. The group was shouting and yelling all sorts of annoying and offensive things. Jonah sighed. It looked like his private contemplation time was over. Now it was time to come crashing back down to reality.
1553321111.title: Over The Horizon

info.brief_description: Like the title says, Gentle Male Giants. 300 GPs for every good chapter
info.description:
So I've seen alot of gentle female giants, but there's only one or two gentle male giant stories. So here it is!

1. NO FEMALE GIANTS! There are ALOT of other gentle giantess stories to add to.

2. There can be evil giants, but the gentle giant is the main character. The gentle gaint CANNOT turn evil.

3. There CAN be more than one gentle giant in each story.

4. Like my other stories, I alow language, gay characters, and sex.

5. PLEASE ADD! I will be giving 300 GPs for every GOOD chapter. By that I mean, a decent length. Don't post one or two sentences and expect the GPs.

HAVE FUN!
